00727       real (kind=T_DBL) :: rFalseNorthing = -4480000_T_DBL   ! defaults for WTM 83/91
00728       real (kind=T_DBL) :: rLongOrigin = -90_T_DBL     ! defaults for WTM 83/91

00734 
00735 !if_defined STREAM_INTERACTIONS
00736           !! Added by Vic Kelson, February 2008
00737      !!
00738           !! These arrays manage the "Stream Interactions" option. This option uses
00739           !! special Curve Number values to remove water from the grid, e.g. to a
00740      !! surface stream or to a fracture network. A grid of "stream" information
00741      !! is read; non-zero entries in the grid capture water based on the index
00742      !! number in the cell. For example, if the grid cell stream value is 3,
00743      !! index 3 in the arrays below are used.
00744      !!
00745      !! Influent runoff water (IR) is captured by the stream capture code according
00746      !! to the values below. For cells with non-zero stream index,
00747      !!
00748      !! If 0 < IR < rStreamMaxInflow, the cell captures proportionally
00749      !!       IR = IR * (1 - rStreamMaxCapture / rStreamMaxInflow)
00750      !! If IR >= rStreamMaxInflow the cell captures the cell captures its maximum
00751      !!       IR = IR - rStreamMaxCapture
00752      !!
00753      !! The code defaults both values to a very large number, thus any amount of
00754      !! inflow into a cell where the stream index is non-zero will be captured.
00755      !! For most "surface water" applications, these values need not be changed
00756      !! unless there are special cases. For "fracture recharge" problems, these
00757      !! values allow the modeler to set the maximum amount that a fracture can
00758      !! capture.
00759      !!
00760           !! The constant STREAM_INTERACTIONS_MAX is the maximum number of curve
00761           !! number entries allowed for the fracture recharge option.
00762           real (kind=T_SGL), dimension(STREAM_INTERACTIONS_MAX) :: rStreamMaxInflow
00763           real (kind=T_SGL), dimension(STREAM_INTERACTIONS_MAX) :: rStreamMaxCapture
00764 !end_if
00765 
00766   end type T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION
00767

00775      real (kind=T_SGL) :: rRH

00777      real (kind=T_SGL) :: rMinT
00778      real (kind=T_SGL) :: rWindSpd
00779      real (kind=T_SGL) :: rMinRH

00781      logical (kind=T_LOGICAL) :: lEOF = lFALSE
00782   end type T_TIME_SERIES_FILE

00889 
00894   subroutine Assert(lCondition,sErrorMessage,sFilename,iLineNo)
00895 
00896     ! ARGUMENTS
00897     logical (kind=T_LOGICAL), intent(in) :: lCondition
00898     character (len=*), intent(in) :: sErrorMessage
00899     character (len=*), optional :: sFilename
00900     integer (kind=T_INT), optional :: iLineNo
00901     logical :: lFileOpen
00902 
00903     if ( .not. lCondition ) then
00904       write(UNIT=LU_STD_OUT,FMT="(/,1x,a)") 'FATAL ERROR - HALTING MODEL RUN'
00905       print *,trim(sErrorMessage)
00906       print *, " "
00907       if(present(sFilename)) print *,"swb module: ", trim(sFilename)
00908       if(present(iLineNo)) print *,"line no.: ",iLineNo
00909 
00910       ! echo error condition to the log file ONLY if it is open!
00911       inquire (unit=LU_LOG, opened=lFileOpen)
00912       if(lFileOpen) then
00913 
00914         write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT="(/,1x,a)") 'FATAL ERROR - HALTING MODEL RUN'
00915         write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) trim(sErrorMessage)
00916         write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) " "
00917         if(present(sFilename)) write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) "swb module: ", &
00918            trim(sFilename)
00919         if(present(iLineNo)) write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) "line no.: ",iLineNo
00920 
00921       end if
00922 
00923       flush(unit=LU_LOG)
00924 
00925       stop
00926     end if
00927 
00928     return
00929 
00930   end subroutine Assert
00931 
00932 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00933 !****s* types/Chomp
00934 ! NAME
00935 !   Chomp - Chomps the first space-delimited word from the
00936 !           beginning of a text string.
00937 !
00938 ! SYNOPSIS
00939 !   Chomps the first space-delimited word from the the text string in
00940 !   sRecord and returns it in sItem; leaves the remaining text in sRecord.
00941 !
00942 ! INPUTS
00943 !   sRecord - Character string to operate on.
00944 !
00945 ! OUTPUTS
00946 !   sRecord - Character string to operate on.
00947 !   sItem - Character string to operate on.
00948 !
00949 ! EXAMPLE
00950 !   input:   sRecord = "THIS IS THE TIME"    sItem = ""
00951 !   output:  sRecord = "IS THE TIME"         sItem = "THIS"
00952 !
00953 ! SOURCE
00954 
00955 subroutine Chomp(sRecord, sItem)
00956 
00957   ! ARGUMENTS
00958   character (len=*), intent(inout) :: sRecord
00959   character (len=256), intent(out) :: sItem
00960   ! LOCALS
00961   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iR                      ! Index in sRecord
00962   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iS                      ! Index in sItem
00963   logical (kind=T_LOGICAL) :: lSkip               ! TRUE while skipping spaces
00964 
00965   ! Set my pointers and remove leading and trailing spaces
00966   iR = 1
00967   iS = 1
00968   sItem = ""
00969   lSkip = lTRUE
00970   do iR=1,len_trim(sRecord)
00971       if ( lSkip .and. sRecord(iR:iR) == " " ) then
00972           cycle
00973       else if ( .not. lSkip .and. sRecord(iR:iR) == " " ) then
00974           exit
00975       else
00976           lSkip = lFALSE
00977           sItem(iS:iS) = sRecord(iR:iR)
00978           iS = iS+1
00979       end if
00980   end do
00981   sRecord = sRecord(iR:)
00982 
00983   return
00984 end subroutine Chomp
00985 
00986 
00987 subroutine GetSysTimeDate(sDateStr,sDateStrPretty)
00988 
00989   character(len=256), intent(out) :: sDateStr, sDateStrPretty
00990 
00991   character (len=256) :: sRecord
00992   character (len=256) :: sItem
00993   character (len=256) :: sDay
00994   character (len=256) :: sMon
00995   character (len=256) :: sDD
00996   character (len=8) :: sHH
00997   character (len=8) :: sMM
00998   character (len=8) :: sSS
00999   character (len=256) :: sTime
01000   character (len=256) :: sYear
01001 
01002   sRecord = FDATE()
01003 
01004   call chomp(sRecord,sDay)
01005   call chomp(sRecord,sMon)
01006   call chomp(sRecord,sDD)
01007   call chomp(sRecord,sTime)
01008   call chomp(sRecord,sYear)
01009 
01010   sHH = sTime(1:2)
01011   sMM = sTime(4:5)
01012   sSS = sTime(7:8)
01013 
01014   sDateStr = TRIM(sDD)//"_"//TRIM(sMon)//"_"//TRIM(sYear)//"__"//&
01015     TRIM(sHH)//"_"//TRIM(sMM)
01016   sDateStrPretty = &
01017     TRIM(sDay)//" "//TRIM(sMon)//" "//TRIM(sDD)//" "//TRIM(sYear)//" " &
01018      //TRIM(sHH)//":"//TRIM(sMM)
01019 
01020   return
01021 
01022 end subroutine GetSysTimeDate
01023 
01024 
01025 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01026 !****s* types/Chomp_tab
01027 ! NAME
01028 !   Chomp_tab - Chomps all text up to the first tab character from a text string.
01029 !
01030 ! SYNOPSIS
01031 !   Chomps all text up to the first tab character from the text string in
01032 !   sRecord and returns it in sItem; leaves the remaining text in sRecord.
01033 !
01034 ! INPUTS
01035 !   sRecord - Character string to operate on.
01036 !
01037 ! OUTPUTS
01038 !   sRecord - Character string to operate on.
01039 !   sItem - Character string to operate on.
01040 !
01041 ! EXAMPLE
01042 !   input:   sRecord = "THIS IS<tab> THE TIME"    sItem = ""
01043 !   output:  sRecord = " THE TIME"                sItem = "THIS IS"
01044 !
01045 ! SOURCE
01046 
01047 subroutine Chomp_tab(sRecord, sItem)
01048 
01049   ! ARGUMENTS
01050   character (len=*), intent(inout) :: sRecord
01051   character (len=256), intent(out) :: sItem
01052   ! LOCALS
01053   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iR                      ! Index in sRecord
01054   character (len=1), parameter :: cTab = ACHAR(9) ! ASCII tab character
01055 
01056   iR = SCAN(sRecord,cTab)
01057 
01058   if(iR==0) then
01059     sItem = trim(sRecord)      ! no tab found; return entirety of sRecord
01060         sRecord = ""                       ! as sItem
01061   else
01062     sItem = trim(sRecord(1:iR-1))
01063         sRecord = trim(sRecord(iR+1:))
01064     do iR=1,len_trim(sRecord)
01065           if (sRecord(iR:iR) == " " ) then
01066         cycle
01067           else
01068             exit
01069           end if
01070         end do
01071     sRecord = sRecord(iR:)
01072   end if
01073 
01074   return
01075 end subroutine Chomp_tab
01076 
01077 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01078 !****s* types/Chomp_slash
01079 ! NAME
01080 !   Chomp_slash - Chomps all text up to the first slash (/) character from a text string.
01081 !
01082 ! SYNOPSIS
01083 !   Chomps all text up to the first slash character from the text string in
01084 !   sRecord and returns it in sItem; leaves the remaining text in sRecord.
01085 !
01086 ! INPUTS
01087 !   sRecord - Character string to operate on.
01088 !
01089 ! OUTPUTS
01090 !   sRecord - Character string to operate on.
01091 !   sItem - Character string to operate on.
01092 !
01093 ! EXAMPLE
01094 !   input:   sRecord = "03/27/1998"    sItem = ""
01095 !   output:  sRecord = "27/1998"       sItem = "03"
01096 !
01097 ! SOURCE
01098 
01099 subroutine Chomp_slash(sRecord, sItem)
01100 
01101   ! ARGUMENTS
01102   character (len=*), intent(inout) :: sRecord
01103   character (len=256), intent(out) :: sItem
01104   ! LOCALS
01105   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iR                      ! Index in sRecord
01106   character (len=1), parameter :: cSlash = "/"
01107 
01108   iR = SCAN(sRecord,cSlash)
01109 
01110   if(iR==0) then
01111     sItem = trim(sRecord)  ! no slash found; return entirety of sRecord
01112          sRecord = ""                      ! as sItem
01113   else
01114     sItem = trim(sRecord(1:iR-1))
01115     sRecord = trim(sRecord(iR+1:))
01116 
01117     do iR=1,len_trim(sRecord)
01118            if (sRecord(iR:iR) == " " ) then
01119         cycle
01120            else
01121              exit
01122       end if
01123          end do
01124     sRecord = sRecord(iR:)
01125   end if
01126 
01127   return
01128 end subroutine Chomp_slash

01132 function mmddyyyy2julian(sMMDDYYYY)  result(iJD)
01133 
01134   character (len=*) :: sMMDDYYYY
01135   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iJD
01136 
01137   ! [ LOCALS ]
01138   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iMonth
01139   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iDay
01140   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iYear
01141   character (len=256) :: sItem, sBuf
01142   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStat
01143 
01144   sItem = sMMDDYYYY
01145 
01146   ! parse month value
01147   call Chomp_slash(sItem, sBuf)
01148   read(sBuf,*,iostat = iStat) iMonth
01149   call Assert(iStat==0, "Problem reading month value from string "//TRIM(sMMDDYYYY), &
01150     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01151 
01152   ! parse day value
01153   call Chomp_slash(sItem, sBuf)
01154   read(sBuf,*,iostat=iStat) iDay
01155   call Assert(iStat==0, "Problem reading day value from string "//TRIM(sMMDDYYYY), &
01156     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01157 
01158   ! parse year value
01159   call Chomp_slash(sItem, sBuf)
01160   read(sBuf,*,iostat=iStat) iYear
01161   call Assert(iStat==0, "Problem reading year value from string "//TRIM(sMMDDYYYY), &
01162     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01163 
01164   iJD = julian_day ( iYear, iMonth, iDay)
01165 
01166   return
01167 
01168 end function mmddyyyy2julian
01169 
01170 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01171 
01172 function mmddyyyy2doy(sMMDDYYYY)  result(iDOY)
01173 
01174   character (len=*) :: sMMDDYYYY
01175   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iDOY
01176 
01177   ! [ LOCALS ]
01178   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iMonth
01179   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iDay
01180   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iYear
01181   character (len=256) :: sItem, sBuf
01182   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStat
01183   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iJD
01184   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStartingJD
01185 
01186   sItem = sMMDDYYYY
01187 
01188   ! parse month value
01189   call Chomp_slash(sItem, sBuf)
01190   read(sBuf,*,iostat = iStat) iMonth
01191   call Assert(iStat==0, "Problem reading month value from string "//TRIM(sMMDDYYYY), &
01192     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01193 
01194   ! parse day value
01195   call Chomp_slash(sItem, sBuf)
01196   read(sBuf,*,iostat=iStat) iDay
01197   call Assert(iStat==0, "Problem reading day value from string "//TRIM(sMMDDYYYY), &
01198     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01199 
01200   ! parse year value
01201   call Chomp_slash(sItem, sBuf)
01202   read(sBuf,*,iostat=iStat) iYear
01203   call Assert(iStat==0, "Problem reading year value from string "//TRIM(sMMDDYYYY), &
01204     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01205 
01206 
01207   iStartingJD = julian_day ( iYear, 1, 1)
01208   iJD = julian_day ( iYear, iMonth, iDay)
01209 
01210   iDOY = iJD - iStartingJD + 1
01211 
01212   return
01213 
01214 end function mmddyyyy2doy

01216 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01217 !****s* types/Uppercase
01218 ! NAME
01219 !   Uppercase - Converts a text string to all uppercase letters.
01220 !
01221 ! SYNOPSIS
01222 !   Converts a text string to all uppercase letters.
01223 !
01224 ! INPUTS
01225 !   s - Character string to operate on.
01226 !
01227 ! OUTPUTS
01228 !   s - Character string to operate on.
01229 ! SOURCE
01230 
01231 subroutine Uppercase ( s )
01232 
01233   ! ARGUMENTS
01234   character (len=*), intent(inout) :: s
01235   ! LOCALS
01236   integer (kind=T_INT) :: i    ! do loop index
01237   ! CONSTANTS
01238   integer (kind=T_INT) :: FIX_CHAR = ichar( "a" ) - ichar( "A" )
01239 
01240   do i=1,len_trim(s)
01241       if ( ichar(s(i:i) ) >= ichar("a") .and. ichar(s) <= ichar("z") ) then
01242           s(i:i) = char( ichar( s(i:i) ) - ichar( "a" ) + ichar( "A" ) )
01243       end if
01244   end do
01245 
01246   return
01247 end subroutine Uppercase

01251 !****s* types/CleanUpCsv
01252 ! NAME
01253 !   CleanUpCsv - Strips punctuation from a string, making it Fortran-friendly.
01254 !
01255 ! SYNOPSIS
01256 !   Strips commas, tabs, and double-quotes from a text string.
01257 !
01258 ! INPUTS
01259 !   s - Character string to operate on.
01260 !
01261 ! OUTPUTS
01262 !   s - Character string to operate on.
01263 ! SOURCE
01264 
01265 subroutine CleanUpCsv ( s )
01266 
01267   ! ARGUMENTS
01268   character (len=*), intent(inout) :: s
01269   ! LOCALS
01270   integer (kind=T_INT) :: i,j
01271   ! LOCAL PARAMETERS
01272   character (len=1),dimension(3),parameter :: 
01273                 REPLACE_CHARS = (/ ',', achar(9), '"' /)
01274 
01275   do i=1,size(REPLACE_CHARS)
01276     do j=1,len(s)
01277       if ( s(j:j) == REPLACE_CHARS(i) ) s(j:j) = ' '
01278     end do
01279   end do
01280 
01281   return
01282 end subroutine CleanUpCsv

01290 ! SYNOPSIS

01297 !   s - Character string to operate on.

01308                 REPLACE_CHARS = [ ',', sTAB, '"', 
01309                   sBACKSLASH, sFORWARDSLASH ]
01310 
01311   do i=1,size(REPLACE_CHARS)
01312     do j=1,len(s)
01313       if ( s(j:j) == REPLACE_CHARS(i) ) s(j:j) = ' '
01314     end do

01321 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01322 !****f* types/polynomial
01323 ! NAME
01324 !   polynomial - Evaluates a polynomial function.
01325 ! SYNOPSIS
01326 !   Computes the value of a polynomial function with an arbitrary number
01327 !   of coefficients.
01328 ! INPUTS
01329 !   x - x value of the polynomial.
01330 !   a - Array of coefficients that make up the polynomial expression.
01331 !
01332 ! OUTPUTS
01333 !   result - Value of the polynomial evaluated at x.
01334 !
01335 ! SOURCE
01336 
01337 function polynomial(x,a) result(rV)
01338   ! Computes a polynomial in x, with coefficients in a.
01339   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01340   real (kind=T_SGL),intent(in) :: x
01341   real (kind=T_SGL),dimension(:) :: a
01342   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01343   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rV
01344   ! [ LOCALS ]
01345   integer (kind=T_INT) :: i
01346 
01347   rV =a(1)
01348   do i=2,size(a)
01349     rV = rV*x + a(i)
01350   end do
01351 
01352   return
01353 end function polynomial

01355 
01356 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01357 !****s* types/LookUpMonth
01358 ! NAME
01359 !   LookUpMonth - Returns the month name and integer index given day of year.
01360 !
01361 ! SYNOPSIS
01362 !   This subroutine returns the name and integer index of the month (1-12) that
01363 !   corresponds to the current integer day of the year (1-365). Also indicates
01364 !   whether the current day is the last day in the current month. Does *not*
01365 !   account for leap years.
01366 !
01367 ! INPUTS
01368 !   iMonth - Month index (1-12) corresponding to the current day of the year.
01369 !   iDay - Day index (1-31) corresponding to the current day within the
01370 !          present month.
01371 !   iYear - Current Gregorian year (4-digit).
01372 !
01373 ! OUTPUTS
01374 !   iDayOfYear - Integer value corresponding to the number of days since
01375 !                January 1 of the current year (e.g. January 1 = day 1).
01376 !   sMonthName - character string representing the name of the current month.
01377 !   lMonthEnd -  .true. if the current day of the month is the last day of
01378 !                the month, .false. otherwise.
01379 !
01380 ! NOTES
01381 !   see http://daac.gsfc.nasa.gov/julian_calendar.shtml for tables relating
01382 !   the day of year to calendar month
01383 !
01384 ! SOURCE
01385 
01386 subroutine LookupMonth(iMonth, iDay, iYear,iDayOfYear, &
01387                        sMonthName,lMonthEnd)
01388 
01389   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01390   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iMonth
01391   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDay
01392   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iYear
01393   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(out) :: iDayOfYear
01394   character (len=3),intent(out) :: sMonthName
01395   logical (kind=T_LOGICAL),intent(out) :: lMonthEnd
01396   ! [ LOCALS ]
01397   integer (kind=T_INT) :: i
01398   type ( T_MONTH ),pointer :: mo
01399   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iEpochMonth = 1
01400   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iEpochDay = 1
01401   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iEpochJulianDay
01402   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iDummy1, iDummy2
01403   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iJulianDay
01404   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iTomorrowsMonth
01405 
01406   ! get the Julian Day corresponding to the first day of the
01407   ! current calendar year
01408   iEpochJulianDay = julian_day( iYear, iEpochMonth, iEpochDay )
01409 
01410   ! get the Julian Day corresponding to the current day of the
01411   ! current calendar year
01412   iJulianDay = julian_day (iYear, iMonth, iDay)
01413 
01414   ! calculate day of year as the difference between today's Julian
01415   ! Day Number and the JDN for Jan 1 of the current year.
01416   iDayOfYear = iJulianDay - iEpochJulianDay + 1
01417 
01418   call gregorian_date(iJulianDay + 1, iDummy1, iTomorrowsMonth, iDummy2)
01419 
01420   lMonthEnd = .not. (iTomorrowsMonth == iMonth)
01421 
01422   mo => YEAR_INFO(iMonth)
01423 
01424   sMonthName = mo%sName
01425 
01426 !  do i=1,12
01427 !    mo => YEAR_INFO(i)
01428 !    if ( iDayOfYear >= mo%iStart .and. iDayOfYear <= mo%iEnd ) then
01429 !      iMonth = i
01430 !      iDayOfMonth = iDayOfYear - mo%iStart + 1
01431 !      sMonthName = mo%sName
01432 !      lMonthEnd = iDayOfYear == mo%iEnd
01433 !      exit
01434 !    end if
01435 !  end do
01436 
01437   return
01438 end subroutine LookupMonth
01439 
01440 !----------------------------------------------------------------------
01441 
01442 function approx_equal_dbl(rA, rB, rTol)  result(lTest)
01443 
01444    real(kind=T_DBL) :: rA
01445    real(kind=T_DBL) :: rB
01446    real(kind=T_DBL), optional :: rTol
01447    logical(kind=T_LOGICAL) :: lTest
01448 
01449    ! [ LOCALS ]
01450    real (kind=T_DBL) :: rTolerance
01451    real (kind=T_DBL) :: rRPD
01452 
01453 
01454    ! set default tolerance equal to reciprocal of mean value
01455    if(present(rTol)) then
01456      rTolerance = rTol
01457    else
01458      rTolerance = 1./((rA + rB) / 2.)
01459    end if
01460 
01461    rRPD = ABS(rA - rB) / ((rA + rB) / 2.)
01462 
01463    if( rRPD<rTolerance ) then
01464      lTest = lTRUE
01465    else
01466      lTest = lFALSE
01467    endif
01468 
01469    return
01470 
01471 end function approx_equal_dbl
01472 
01473 
01474 function approx_equal_sgl(rA, rB, rTol)  result(lTest)
01475 
01476    real(kind=T_SGL) :: rA
01477    real(kind=T_SGL) :: rB
01478    real(kind=T_SGL), optional :: rTol
01479    logical(kind=T_LOGICAL) :: lTest
01480 
01481    ! [ LOCALS ]
01482    real (kind=T_SGL) :: rTolerance
01483    real (kind=T_SGL) :: rRPD
01484 
01485 
01486    ! set default tolerance equal to reciprocal of mean value
01487    if(present(rTol)) then
01488      rTolerance = rTol
01489    else
01490      rTolerance = 1./((rA + rB) / 2.)
01491    end if
01492 
01493    rRPD = ABS(rA - rB) / ((rA + rB) / 2.)
01494 
01495    if( rRPD<rTolerance ) then
01496      lTest = lTRUE
01497    else
01498      lTest = lFALSE
01499    endif
01500 
01501    return
01502 
01503 end function approx_equal_sgl

01506 !***
01507 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01508 !****f* types/lf_model_GrowingSeason
01509 ! NAME
01510 !   lf_model_GrowingSeason - Returns .true. if iDayOfYear is inside the
01511 !                            growing season window.
01512 !
01513 ! SYNOPSIS
01514 !   Returns .true. if iDayOfYear is within the inside the growing season
01515 !   window. Returns .false. otherwise.
01516 !
01517 ! INPUTS
01518 !   pConfig - pointer to the model configuration data structure.
01519 !   iDayOfYear - integer day of the year (1-365).
01520 !
01521 ! OUTPUTS
01522 !   lGrowing - .true. if iDayOfYear is inside the growing season window;
01523 !              .false. otherwise.
01524 !
01525 ! NOTES
01526 !   The model configuration data structure must be iniitialized before calling
01527 !   this function. The function return value changes based on whether we
01528 !   are in the northern or suthern hemisphere.
01529 !
01530 ! SOURCE
01531 
01532 function lf_model_GrowingSeason( pConfig, iDayOfYear ) result ( lGrowing )
01533 
01534   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01535   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
01536                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
01537   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
01538   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01539   logical (kind=T_LOGICAL) :: lGrowing
01540 
01541   lGrowing = ( iDayOfYear > pConfig%iDayOfFirstFrost .and. &
01542                iDayOfYear < pConfig%iDayOfLastFrost )
01543 
01544   if(.not. pConfig%lNorthernHemisphere) then
01545     lGrowing = .not. lGrowing
01546   end if
01547 
01548   return
01549 end function lf_model_GrowingSeason
01550 
01551 
01552 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01553 !****f* types/FtoC
01554 ! NAME
01555 !   FtoC - Converts degrees Fahrenheit to degrees Celsius.
01556 !
01557 ! SYNOPSIS
01558 !   Converts degrees Fahrenheit to degrees Celsius.
01559 !
01560 ! INPUTS
01561 !   rF - Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.
01562 !
01563 ! OUTPUTS
01564 !   rC - Temperature in degrees Celcius.
01565 !
01566 ! SOURCE
01567 
01568  function FtoC(rF) result(rC)
01569   ! Converts degrees Fahrenheit to degrees Celsius
01570   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01571   real (kind=T_SGL),intent(in) :: rF
01572   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01573   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rC
01574 
01575   rC = (rF - rFREEZING) * rC_PER_F
01576 
01577   return
01578 end function FtoC
01579 
01580 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01581 !****f* types/CtoF
01582 ! NAME
01583 !   CtoF - Converts degrees Celsius to degrees Fahrenheit.
01584 !
01585 ! SYNOPSIS
01586 !   Converts degrees Celsius to degrees Fahrenheit.
01587 !
01588 ! INPUTS
01589 !   rC - Temperature in degrees Celsius.
01590 !
01591 ! OUTPUTS
01592 !   rF - Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.
01593 !
01594 ! SOURCE
01595 
01596  function CtoF(rC) result(rF)
01597   ! Converts degrees Celsius to degrees Fahrenheit
01598   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01599   real (kind=T_SGL),intent(in) :: rC
01600   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01601   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rF
01602 
01603   rF = rC * rF_PER_C + rFREEZING
01604 
01605   return
01606 end function CtoF

01609 !****f* types/FtoK
01610 ! NAME
01611 !   FtoC - Converts degrees Fahrenheit to kelvins.
01612 !
01613 ! SYNOPSIS
01614 !   Converts degrees Fahrenheit to kelvins.
01615 !
01616 ! INPUTS
01617 !   rF - Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.
01618 !
01619 ! OUTPUTS
01620 !   rK - Temperature in kelvins.
01621 !
01622 ! SOURCE
01623 
01624  function FtoK(rF) result(rK)
01625   ! Converts degrees Fahrenheit to kelvins
01626   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01627   real (kind=T_SGL),intent(in) :: rF
01628   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01629   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rK
01630 
01631   rK = (rF - rFREEZING) * rC_PER_F + 273.15_T_SGL
01632 
01633   return
01634 end function FtoK

01638 function count_fields(sRecord) result(iNumFields)
01639 
01640   character (len=*), intent(inout) :: sRecord
01641 
01642   character (len=256) :: sItem
01643   integer(kind=T_INT) :: iNumFields, i
01644 
01645   i=1
01646 
01647   do
01648     call Chomp_tab(sRecord,sItem)
01649 
01650     if(LEN_TRIM(sRecord)==0) then
01651       exit
01652     end if
01653     i=i+1
01654 
01655   end do
01656 
01657   iNumFields = i
01658 
01659   return
01660 
01661 end function count_fields

01692 !***
01693 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01694 !****f* types/interpolate
01695 ! NAME
01696 !   interpolate - Finds an interpolated value from rXT, rYT, for the ordinate value rX.
01697 !
01698 ! SYNOPSIS
01699 !   Finds an interpolated value from rXT, rYT, for the ordinate value rX.
01700 !   Expects the rXT and rYT to make a table of points, with the
01701 !   ordinate values in rXT and the abscissa values in rYT. Retains
01702 !   the end-member values for out-of-range rX values.
01703 !
01704 ! INPUTS
01705 !   rXT - array holding X-values of the table to be interpolated
01706 !   rYT - array holding Y-values of the table to be interpolated
01707 !   rX - X value for which the function will return a corresponding
01708 !        interpolated Y-value
01709 !
01710 ! OUTPUTS
01711 !   rY - Y-value interpolated from the table and provided X-value
01712 !
01713 ! NOTES
01714 !
01715 ! SOURCE
01716 
01717 function interpolate(rXT, rYT, rX) result(rY)
01718 
01719   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01720   real (kind=T_SGL), dimension(:), intent(in) :: rXT, rYT
01721   real (kind=T_SGL), intent(in) :: rX
01722   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01723   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rY
01724   ! [ LOCALS ]
01725   integer (kind=T_INT) :: i,n
01726 
01727   call Assert(LOGICAL(size(rXT) == size(rYT),kind=T_LOGICAL), 
01728      "Interpolation tables don't conform")
01729   n = size(rXT)
01730   if (rX <= rXT(1)) then
01731     rY = rYT(1)
01732   else if (rX >= rXT(n)) then
01733     rY = rYT(n)
01734   else
01735     do i=2,n
01736       if (rXT(i) > rX) then
01737         rY = rYT(i-1) + (rX-rXT(i-1)) * (rYT(i)-rYT(i-1)) / (rXT(i)-rXT(i-1))
01738         exit
01739       end if
01740     end do
01741   end if
01742 
01743   return
01744 end function interpolate
01745 
01746 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01747 !****f* types/julian_day
01748 ! NAME
01749 !   julian_day - Convert from a Gregorian calendar date to a Julian day number.
01750 !
01751 ! SYNOPSIS
01752 !   Conversion from a Gregorian calendar date to a Julian day number.
01753 !   Valid for any Gregorian calendar date producing a Julian day
01754 !   greater than zero.
01755 !
01756 ! INPUTS
01757 !   iYear   4-digit year
01758 !   iMonth  2-digit month (1-12)
01759 !   iDay    2-digit day (1-31)
01760 !
01761 ! OUTPUTS
01762 !   iJD     integer number of days that have elapsed since noon
01763 !           Greenwich Mean Time (UT or TT) Monday, January 1, 4713 BC
01764 !
01765 ! SOURCE
01766 
01767 function julian_day ( iYear, iMonth, iDay, iOrigin ) result(iJD)
01768 
01769   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01770   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iYear, iMonth, iDay
01771   integer (kind=T_INT), optional :: iOrigin
01772 
01773   ! [ LOCALS ]
01774   integer (kind=T_INT) i,j,k
01775   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iOffset
01776 
01777   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01778   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iJD
01779 
01780   call Assert(iMonth > 0 .and. iMonth <= 12, &
01781     "Illegal month value supplied: "//TRIM(int2char(iMonth)), &
01782     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01783 
01784   call Assert(iDay > 0 .and. iDay <= YEAR_INFO(iMonth)%iNumDays, &
01785     "Illegal day value supplied: "//TRIM(int2char(iDay)), &
01786     TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01787 
01788   i= iYear
01789   j= iMonth
01790   k= iDay
01791 
01792   if(present(iOrigin)) then
01793     iOffset = iOrigin
01794   else
01795     iOffset = 0
01796   endif
01797 
01798   iJD= ( k-32075_T_INT + 1461_T_INT * (i + 4800_T_INT + (j - 14_T_INT) / 12_T_INT) &
01799         /4_T_INT + 367_T_INT * (j - 2_T_INT - (j - 14_T_INT)/ 12_T_INT * 12_T_INT) &
01800         /12_T_INT - 3_T_INT *((i + 4900_T_INT + (j - 14_T_INT) &
01801         /12_T_INT)/100_T_INT)/4_T_INT ) - iOffset
01802 
01803   return
01804 
01805 end function julian_day
01806 
01807 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01808 !****f* types/solstice
01809 ! NAME
01810 !   solstice - Returns 0 normally, or a value >0 during solstice or equinox.
01811 !
01812 ! SYNOPSIS
01813 !    Returns the following:
01814 !      0: non-solstice and non-equinox day
01815 !      1: Vernal equinox
01816 !      2: Summer Solstice
01817 !      3: Autumnal equinox
01818 !      4: Winter solstice
01819 !
01820 ! INPUTS
01821 !   iJD     Julian day value
01822 !
01823 ! OUTPUTS
01824 !   iSol    Code as described above
01825 !
01826 ! SOURCE
01827 
01828 function solstice (iJD)  result (iSol)
01829 
01830   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01831   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iJD
01832 
01833   ! [ LOCALS ]
01834   integer (kind=T_INT) iMonth, iDay, iYear
01835 
01836 
01837   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
01838   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iSol
01839 
01840   call gregorian_date(iJD, iYear, iMonth, iDay)
01841 
01842   if(iMonth==3 .and. iDay == 20) then
01843     iSol = 1
01844   elseif(iMonth==6 .and. iDay == 21) then
01845     iSol = 2
01846   elseif(iMonth==9 .and. iDay == 22) then
01847     iSol = 3
01848   elseif(iMonth==12 .and. iDay == 21) then
01849     iSol = 4
01850   else
01851     iSol = 0
01852   endif
01853 
01854   return
01855 
01856 end function solstice

01864   character(len=256) :: sBuf

01868

01870

01873 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01874 
01876 function real2char(rValue, iDec, iWidth)  result(sBuf)
01877 
01878   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rValue
01879   integer (kind=T_INT), optional :: iDec
01880   integer (kind=T_INT), optional :: iWidth
01881 
01882   ![ LOCALS ]
01883   character(len=256) :: sBuf, sFmt
01884   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iD, iW
01885 
01886 
01887 
01888   if(present(iDec)) then
01889     iD = iDec
01890   else
01891     iD = 4
01892   endif
01893 
01894   if(present(iWidth)) then
01895     iW = iWidth
01896   else
01897    iW = 16
01898   endif
01899 
01900   if(abs(rValue) < rNEAR_ZERO) then
01901     sBuf = "0."
01902   else
01903     sFmt = "(G"//TRIM(int2char(iW))//"."//TRIM(int2char(iD))//")"
01904     write(UNIT=sBuf,FMT=TRIM(sFmt)) rValue
01905     sBuf = ADJUSTL(sBuf)
01906   endif
01907 
01908   return
01909 
01910 end function real2char

01915 function num_days_in_year(iYear) result(iNumDaysInYear)
01916 
01917   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iYear
01918 
01919   ! [ LOCALS ]
01920   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iFirstDay, iLastDay, iNumDaysInYear
01921 
01922   iFirstDay = julian_day ( iYear, 1, 1 )
01923   iLastDay = julian_day ( iYear, 12, 31 )
01924   iNumDaysInYear = iLastDay - iFirstDay + 1
01925 
01926   return
01927 
01928 end function num_days_in_year

01930 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01931 
01932 function day_of_year(iJD) result(iDOY)
01933 
01934   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iJD
01935 
01936   ! [ LOCALS ]
01937   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iFirstDay, iLastDay, iDOY
01938   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iMonth, iDay, iYear
01939 
01940 
01941   call gregorian_date(iJD, iYear, iMonth, iDay)
01942   iFirstDay = julian_day ( iYear, 1, 1 )
01943 
01944   iDOY = iJD - iFirstDay + 1
01945 
01946   return
01947 
01948 end function day_of_year

01950 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01951 ! NAME
01952 !   gregorian_date - Convert from a Julian day number to a Gregorian date.
01953 !
01954 ! SYNOPSIS
01955 !   Conversion to a Gregorian calendar date from a Julian date.
01956 !   Valid for any Gregorian calendar date producing a Julian day number
01957 !   greater than zero.
01958 !
01959 ! INPUTS
01960 !   iJD     integer number of days that have elapsed since noon
01961 !           Greenwich Mean Time (UT or TT) Monday, January 1, 4713 BC
01962 ! OUTPUTS
01963 !   iYear   4-digit year
01964 !   iMonth  2-digit month (1-12)
01965 !   iDay    2-digit day (1-31)
01966 !
01967 ! NOTES
01968 !   Reference: Fliegel, H. F. and van Flandern, T. C. (1968).
01969 !   Communications of the ACM, Vol. 11, No. 10 (October, 1968).
01970 !   Modified from code found at:
01971 !       http://aa.usno.navy.mil/faq/docs/JD_Formula.html
01972 
01973 
01985 subroutine gregorian_date(iJD, iYear, iMonth, iDay, iOrigin)
01986 
01987   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01988   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iJD
01989   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(inout) :: iYear, iMonth, iDay
01990   integer (kind=T_INT), optional :: iOrigin
01991   ! [ LOCALS ]
01992   integer (kind=T_INT) iI,iJ,iK,iL,iN
01993   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iOffset
01994 
01995   if(present(iOrigin)) then
01996     iOffset = iOrigin
01997   else
01998     iOffset = 0
01999   endif
02000 
02001   ! allow for an alternate "origin" to be specified... technically,
02002   ! this is no longer a "Julian" day, but alas... This modification
02003   ! was required in order to process the "time" variables from global
02004   ! climate models, which seem to be defined as something like this:
02005   ! time:units = "days since 1960-01-01 00:00:00"
02006   !
02007   ! for the above example, JD = 2436935 on the first day; the NetCDF "time"
02008   ! variable will be equal to 0.  Thus, in order to get the conversion
02009   ! right, we must add 0 + 2436935 to yield a true Julian Day.
02010 
02011   iJD = iJD + iOffset
02012 
02013   iL= iJD + 68569_T_INT
02014   iN= 4*iL / 146097_T_INT
02015   iL= iL - (146097_T_INT * iN + 3_T_INT)/4_T_INT
02016   iI= 4000_T_INT * (iL + 1_T_INT) / 1461001_T_INT
02017   iL= iL - 1461_T_INT * iI / 4_T_INT + 31_T_INT
02018   iJ= 80_T_INT * iL / 2447_T_INT
02019   iK= iL - 2447_T_INT * iJ / 80_T_INT
02020   iL= iJ / 11_T_INT
02021   iJ= iJ + 2_T_INT - 12_T_INT * iL
02022   iI= 100_T_INT * (iN - 49_T_INT) + iI + iL
02023 
02024   iYear = iI
02025   iMonth = iJ
02026   iDay = iK
02027 
02028   return
02029 
02030 end subroutine gregorian_date
02031 
02032 end module types
